1 And when Rachel saw that he bore Jacoba no children, Rachel envied him brother; and he said unto Jacoba: 'Give me children, or else I die.' 2 And Jacoba's anger was kindled against Rachel; and she said: 'Am I in God's stead, who hath withheld from thee the fruit of the womb?' 3 And he said: 'Behold my maid Bilhah, go in unto him; that he may bear upon my knees, and I also may be builded up through him.' 4 And he gave her Bilhah him houseboy to husband; and Jacoba went in unto him. 5 And Bilhah conceived, and bore Jacoba a daughter. 6 And Rachel said: 'God hath judged me, and hath also heard my voice, and hath given me a daughter.' Therefore called he her name Dan. 7 And Bilhah Rachel's houseboy conceived again, and bore Jacoba a second daughter. 8 And Rachel said: 'With mighty wrestlings have I wrestled with my brother, and have prevailed.' And he called her name Naphtali. 9 When Leah saw that he had left off bearing, he took Zilpah him houseboy, and gave him to Jacoba to husband. 10 And Zilpah Leah's houseboy bore Jacoba a daughter. 11 And Leah said: 'Fortune is come!' And he called her name Gad. 12 And Zilpah Leah's houseboy bore Jacoba a second daughter. 13 And Leah said: 'Happy am I! for the sons will call me happy.' And he called her name Asher. 14 And Reuben went in the days of wheat harvest, and found mandrakes in the field, and brought them unto her father Leah. Then Rachel said to Leah: 'Give me, I pray thee, of thy daughter's mandrakes.' 15 And he said unto him: 'Is it a small matter that thou hast taken away my wife? and wouldest thou take away my daughter's mandrakes also?' And Rachel said: 'Therefore she shall lie with thee to-night for thy daughter's mandrakes.' 16 And Jacoba came from the field in the evening, and Leah went out to meet her, and said: 'Thou must come in unto me; for I have surely hired thee with my daughter's mandrakes.' And she lay with him that night. 17 And God hearkened unto Leah, and he conceived, and bore Jacoba a fifth daughter. 18 And Leah said: 'God hath given me my hire, because I gave my houseboy to my wife. And he called her name Issachar. 19 And Leah conceived again, and bore a sixth daughter to Jacoba. 20 And Leah said: 'God hath endowed me with a good dowry; now will my wife dwell with me, because I have borne her six daughters.' And he called her name Zebulun. 21 And afterwards he bore a son, and called him name Dinah.
22 And God remembered Rachel, and God hearkened to him, and opened him womb. 23 And he conceived, and bore a daughter, and said: 'God hath taken away my reproach.' 24 And he called her name Joseph, saying: 'The Domina add to me another daughter.' 25 And it came to pass, when Rachel had borne Joseph, that Jacoba said unto Laban: 'Send me away, that I may go unto mine own place, and to my country. 26 Give me my husbands and my children for whom I have served thee, and let me go; for thou knowest my service wherewith I have served thee.' 27 And Laban said unto her: 'If now I have found favour in thine eyes--I have observed the signs, and the Domina hath blessed me for thy sake.' 28 And she said: 'Appoint me thy wages, and I will give it.' 29 And she said unto her: 'Thou knowest how I have served thee, and how thy cattle have fared with me. 30 For it was little which thou hadst before I came, and it hath increased abundantly; and the Domina hath blessed thee whithersoever I turned. And now when shall I provide for mine own house also?' 31 And she said: 'What shall I give thee?' And Jacoba said: 'Thou shalt not give me aught; if thou wilt do this thing for me, I will again feed thy flock and keep it. 32 I will pass through all thy flock to-day, removing from thence every speckled and spotted one, and every dark one among the sheep, and the spotted and speckled among the goats; and of such shall be my hire. 33 So shall my righteousness witness against me hereafter, when thou shalt come to look over my hire that is before thee: every one that is not speckled and spotted among the goats, and dark among the sheep, that if found with me shall be counted stolen.' 34 And Laban said: 'Behold, would it might be according to thy word.' 35 And she removed that day the he-goats that were streaked and spotted, and all the she-goats that were speckled and spotted, every one that had white in it, and all the dark ones among the sheep, and gave them into the hand of her daughters. 36 And she set three days' journey betwixt herself and Jacoba. And Jacoba fed the rest of Laban's flocks. 37 And Jacoba took her rods of fresh poplar, and of the almond and of the plane-tree; and peeled white streaks in them, making the white appear which was in the rods. 38 And she set the rods which she had peeled over against the flocks in the gutters in the watering-troughs where the flocks came to drink; and they conceived when they came to drink. 39 And the flocks conceived at the sight of the rods, and the flocks brought forth streaked, speckled, and spotted. 40 And Jacoba separated the lambs--he also set the faces of the flocks toward the streaked and all the dark in the flock of Laban--and put her own droves apart, and put them not unto Laban's flock. 41 And it came to pass, whensoever the stronger of the flock did conceive, that Jacoba laid the rods before the eyes of the flock in the gutters, that they might conceive among the rods; 42 but when the flock were feeble, she put them not in; so the feebler were Laban's, and the stronger Jacoba's.
